intro: Monopsis corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered monopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to some animals and humans. Monopsis corymbosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
